content: hermione shell mittens designed by andrea denby this is an easy flexible pattern it looks delicate and pretty but is surprisingly easy and warm i highly recommend the drops alpaca as being really soft offering a huge range of colours lovely to work with and incredibly good value the pattern size below is to fit a medium woman s hand but they are pretty stretchy and i ve found they fit most people if you do want to make them smaller or larger use a smaller or larger hook and/or thicker yarn the foundation row can also be adjusted in multiples of 8 just to give an idea of possible combinations of hook/yarn/number of foundation stitches/finished size i ve made 3 5mm drops delight 4ply 40 fst small for my teenage daughter 3 5mm drops alpaca 4ply 48 fst medium/large 4mm drops alpaca 4ply 40 fst medium loads for my craft stall 4mm drops alpaca 4ply 48 fst very large 4mm noro silk garden lite dk 40 fst medium/large 4mm rowan alpaca dk 40 fst medium 4 5mm rowan aran 32 fst medium my gauge is given below if yours is much different go up or down a hook size accordingly pattern is written in uk crochet terms for us terms fdc = fsc double_crochet= single_crochet treble_crochet = double_crochet materials 1 ball 50g drops alpaca or delight 167m/50g 4mm crochet hook finished size lying flat 9 5cm wide x 22-24cm long 3¾ x 8½ -9½ gauge in 4ply alpaca with 4mm hook two shell and v repeats measures 7 75cm 3 and 8 row measures 9cm 3 ½ stitches chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch double_crochet = double_crochet treble_crochet = treble_crochet v = 1 treble_crochet 1 chain 1 treble_crochet in same stitch shell = 5 treble_crochet in same stitch pattern make a foundation row of 40 fdc join with slip_stitch careful not to twist or by 40 chain join with sl st 1 chain double_crochet in each chain join slip_stitch into chain do not turn round 1 right side 4 chain and 1 treble_crochet in same st as slip_stitch counts as a v * miss next 3 double_crochet make a shell 5 treble_crochet in next double_crochet miss 3 double_crochet make a v 1 treble_crochet 1 chain 1 treble_crochet in next double_crochet * repeat from * to * to end slip_stitch into 3rd of 4 chain turn round 2 wrong side slip_stitch across top of first 3 treble_crochet of shell 4 chain 1 treble_crochet in same 3rd treble_crochet as last slip_stitch * 1 shell in chain space of the v of the previous round 1 v in the 3rd treble_crochet of the shell of previous round * repeat from * to * to end 1 shell in last chain space slip_stitch in 3rd of 4 chain turn repeat round 2 until a total of 12 shorter mitten or 14 longer mitten rounds have been completed ending with a wrong side row turn thumbhole round 1 right side slip_stitch across 3 treble_crochet
